WorkItem.ClosedComment: issue no longer present in v2.2.1
WorkItem.Description:
Two users have reported the same issue with v2.2.0.9 in that when they load their file and goto tools | optimise  select "dps rating" as the thing to optimise then click optimise button they get results back that suggest removing a ring all together. ie: leaving one of the ring sockets empty!!
Â 
I cannot understand what might be causing this and can't see how it could be model specific so I'm logging an issue. I can repeat it every time with the release v2.2.0.9.

Comments.Message:
Nope if you look at Sylfpresent.xml file he has two different rings equipped. Surge Needle Ring and Inscribed Band of the Kirin Tor. Both rings are simple Unique rings. He has provided further testing environment to help narrow it down.

I tried to download the program again today incase I accidently messed up something.
Got v2.2.0.9 from www.codeplex.com/rawr
Loaded my toon from armoury.
Selected my raid buffs
Selected "Enforce Gem Requirements"
Picked out my banked gear
Selected to use JC gems in "Tools" - "Edit Gemming Templates"
Selected Optimize in "Tools" and selected DPS Rating in "calculation to Optimize"

First result gave me a build missing a trinket.
Reloaded my toon and repeated the optimize and the next 4 builds were missing a ring.

To do the same with his XML file ...

1) Load Rawr
2) Click File | Open
3) Load the XML file (sylfpresent.xml)
4) Click Tools | Optimize
5) Select Calculation to optimize: DPS rating
6) Hit the optimize button
I can't reproduce this on the dev version.

Me neither, hopefully recent changes have fixed whatever it was, I thought I'd flag it up though with specific case studies, in case there was an underlying issue. Although I suspect that might need backreving to test v2.2.0.9 code. Probably too much hassle.
